remarks.para: One may be inoperative or removed provided:

numlitem.para: It is verified that flap position RVDT sensors are operative before each departure,
For PW and GE, if right FCU is inoperative or removed, No. 1 demand pump is selected ON during takeoff and landing, and
For PW and GE, if left FCU is inoperative or removed, No. 4 demand pump is selected ON during takeoff and landing.

note.para: If S/B 747-34-2349 or production equivalent has not been incorporated and center FCU is inoperative or removed, MODE 4 of the ground proximity warning system is considered inoperative.
S/B 747-34-2349 has been accomplished on UPS aircraft.

caution.para: IF EICAS STATUS MESSAGE "FLAP SYS MONITOR" IS DISPLAYED, A BLOCK TURN BACK IS REQUIRED.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Triple channel autoland may not be available with an inoperative or removed FCU. If triple channel autoland is not available, status message NO LAND 3 will be displayed.

When operating with an inoperative or removed FCU, if the flight director is selected to the FCC associated with the inoperative or removed FCU channel, the flight director will not be displayed at speeds below 60 knots. Each FCC receives inputs from the associated FCU channel.
The FMC scratch pad message PERF/VNAV UNAVAILABLE may be displayed.
With an inoperative removed L or R FCU, the EICAS advisory message >IDLE DISAGREE may be displayed in flight when selecting idle thrust with flaps not in landing position and engine anti-ice off.
If right FCU is inoperative or removed, select Demand Pump 1 ON for takeoff and landing.
If left FCU is inoperative or removed, select Demand Pump 4 ON for takeoff and landing.

note.para: Display of the EICAS advisory message >IDLE DISAGREE on the ground indicates failure of the ground minimum idle selection system and MEL Item 73-21-1 should be used.

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 2.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "L (C or R) FCU INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

note.para: AD 2005-04-03 requires at least one operative FCU. Needs to be P/N 285U0011-208 in accordance with SB 747-27A2386.
SB 747-27A2386 has been accomplished on all UPS aircraft.

numlitem.para: If status message FLAP CONTROL__ is displayed:

Verify RVDT sensors are operative. This is accomplished by ensuring status message FLAP SYS MONITOR is not displayed. If FLAP SYS MONITOR is not displayed, no additional maintenance action is required unless FCU interchange is elected due to an inoperative GPWS MODE 4.
If the center FCU is inoperative and interchange is necessary for GPWS MODE 4 operation:
Open circuit breakers listed in Step 2. A. (2) below and exchange either the left or right FCU with the center unit.
Close the previously opened circuit breakers.
After interchange, EICAS Status Message FLAP CONTROL __ will re-display to the inoperative FCU position.
If status message FLAP SYS MONITOR is displayed:
Verify the RVDT sensors are operative as follows:
Access CMC Existing Faults for >27 FLAP CONTROL. If any of the following faults are present, all three FCUs detect an RVDT fault. Dispatch is not allowed.
LE_SWITCH FAIL
_RVDT FAIL

Access CMC Existing Faults for >27 FLAP CONTROL. If any of the following faults are present, either an FCU fault or an FCU detected RVDT fault has occurred and the following procedure must be accomplished to verify the RVDT sensors are operative:
_RVDT – FCU-_INTERFACE FAIL
FLAP 26 VAC-_>FCU-_INTERFACE FAIL
Open the following circuit breakers on the P7 panel.
Label each FCU with LEFT, RIGHT and CENTER identification marks so their original location remains known.
Remove the FCU that corresponds to the above reported Interface Fail faults.
Close the above circuit breakers. Verify FLAP SYS MONITOR status message does not appear within 30 seconds. If FLAP SYS MONITOR message appears, dispatch is not allowed.
Open the above circuit breakers and remove one of the FCUs which is still installed. Install this FCU in the vacant slot of the previously removed unit.
Close the above circuit breakers.
Wait a minimum of 30 seconds, if FLAP SYS MONITOR message appears, an RVDT sensor fault is confirmed and dispatch is not allowed
If FLAP SYS MONITOR message does not appear, RVDT sensors are verified to be operative. The removed FCU is classified inoperative.
Open the above circuit breakers and replace the two operable FCUs in their original EE shelf slot. Do not replace the inoperative FCU.

note.para: If the center FCU is inoperative and interchange is necessary for GPWS MODE 4 operation, move either the left or right unit to the removed center FCUs position at this time.

numlitem.para: Close the above circuit breakers. Status message FLAP CONTROL__ will re-display to the removed FCUs position.

caution.para: IF FLAP SYS MONITOR REMAINS DISPLAYED, DISPATCH IS NOT ALLOWED.
